Title: Intrinsic resistance switching in amorphous silicon oxide for high performance SiOx ReRAM devices
Abstract: © 2017In this paper, we present a study of intrinsic bipolar resistance switching in metal-oxide-metal silicon oxide ReRAM devices. Devices exhibit low electroforming voltages (typically − 2.6 V), low switching voltages (± 1 V for setting and resetting), excellent endurance of > 107 switching cycles, good state retention (at room temperature and after 1 h at 260 °C), and narrow distributions of switching voltages and resistance states. We analyse the microstructure of amorphous silicon oxide films and postulate that columnar growth, which results from sputter-deposition of the oxide on rough surfaces, enhances resistance switching behavior.
SubjectAreas: Atomic and Molecular Physics, and Optics
